newsitem.title: GERMANY: German right-winger charged with shooting policeman.
newsitem.headline: German right-winger charged with shooting policeman.

text.p: German prosecutors on Thursday charged a 24-year-old right-wing extremist with the murder of a policeman and other counts of attempted murder.

Prosecutors said the extremist had admitted shooting dead one police officer and wounding a second during a routine traffic inspection in February, but said he acted in "self-defence against the state".

The man has also confessed to shooting a Berlin book dealer to punish east German communists, saying he was angry at the Party of Democratic Socialism (PDS) for disrupting a far-right rally in Berlin on February 15.
The PDS operates an office in the same building as the shopkeeper, who was seriously wounded.
The man was captured after a chase and shootout with police on a motorway east of Hamburg.
Berlin's anti-extremist office for the protection of the constitution warned in a recent report that right-wing militants might resort to violence in the future.
